alert.note: Alert for Copiah; Lincoln (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 2:41PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Lincoln and southwestern Copiah Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 241 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Caseyville, or 14 miles west of Brookhaven, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Caseyville around 245 PM CDT. Loyd Star and Allen around 250 PM CDT. Wesson and Glancy around 310 PM CDT. Martinsville around 315 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Beauregard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
